definition: to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to

sentences.english: What if you mentally ate your fill?
sentences.chinese: 要是想像尽情吃个饱会怎样？

sentences.english: Well, you're only younger once-there's plenty of time for that later.
sentences.chinese: 还是趁年轻尽情享受吧，以后有的是时间工作。

sentences.english: We are victorious, wherefore  let us rejoice.
sentences.chinese: 我们胜利了，因此我们尽情欢乐。

sentences.english: Let me fancy while I may.
sentences.chinese: 让我在能幻想的时候尽情幻想吧。

sentences.english: The best way to eat until you’re satisfied is to savor every bite.
sentences.chinese: 最好的方法就是尽情享受每一口咀嚼。

sentences.english: She not only can be embosomed but also can be kissed seethingly as much as you like.
sentences.chinese: 不但可以紧拥入怀，还可以尽情亲吻。

sentences.english: Overlooking by the window, enjoy270O seascape as much as you like.
sentences.chinese: 凭窗远眺，270O无敌海景尽情收纳。

sentences.english: Enjoy yourselves, because tomorrow morning comes the big ordeal.
sentences.chinese: 尽情欢乐吧，因为明天早上你们将面对重大的考验。

sentences.english: It was time to pig out on rock and roll.
sentences.chinese: 该是尽情享受摇滚乐的时候了。

sentences.english: Life is too short to do anything but celebrate all the time.
sentences.chinese: 人生苦短，尽情地庆祝每一刻吧。

sentences.english: Deduct all of the goodliness things as much as one likes.
sentences.chinese: 尽情演绎人间的一切美好事物。

sentences.english: We hear the nightingale at his best.
sentences.chinese: Me们听见夜莺正在尽情地歌唱。

sentences.english: Ralph was luxuriating in the first real holiday he'd had in years.
sentences.chinese: 拉尔夫那时正在尽情享受多年来的第一次真正假期。

sentences.english: Savor the natural joy of simple pleasures.
sentences.chinese: 尽情享受简单带来的自然愉悦。

sentences.english: So enjoy that extra hour of sunlight in the evening. Carefully.
sentences.chinese: 因此，尽情享受傍晚那一个小时额外的阳光吧。

sentences.english: I hope you jump in rain puddles.
sentences.chinese: 我愿你在雨后水塘里尽情欢跳。

definition: to sprinkle/to shed (tears, blood etc)/fig. free, unconstrained/to write in a free style
free and unconstrained (idiom); unfettered/unbuttoned/without care or worries
to wander about unhurriedly/to linger/to loiter
to sense/perception/to feel (through the senses)/to experience/a feeling/an impression/an experience
unrestrained/cheerful lack of inhibition, esp. for drinking or sleeping/to drink with abandon
